trial_identification.studytitle: Cervical excision in pieces with total hysterectomy in obese patients
trial_identification.scientifictitle: cervical excision in pieces with total hysterectomy for long cervix in deep pelvis with fibroid uterus in female obese patients

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other reproductive health and childbirth disorders

interventions.interventions: cervical excision in pieces after sub total hysterectomy through laparotomy will be done by a gynecologist with 5 years of experience .this will be done in shatby maternity university hospital,alexandria ,egypt.the approximate duration of the procedure is one hour. the cervical branches of the uterine arteries are ligated on both sides then excise the upper part of the cervix .then , ligation of the cervical branches in a lower level with excision of the rest of the cervix .

primaryOutcome.outcome: Success of the procedure, defined as successful completion of the total hysterectomy as judged by the surgeon.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: complications encountered as bleeding assessed by blood transfusion bladder injury and colon injury from medical records
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: during surgery and one week after surgery

secondaryOutcome.outcome: duration of surgery from medical records

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: 1. fibroid uterus equals or larger than 12 weeks pregnant uterus size 2. obese patients with BMI >25 3. patient not desiring fertility 4. patient completed family size 5. intra-operative finding of long cervix with deep pelvis

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: shatby maternity univeristy hospital beside bibliotheca alexandrina ,department of obstetrics and gynecology ,alexandria university,alexandria,egypt,20255

fundingsource.fundingaddress: shatby maternity univeristy hospital beside bibliotheca alexandrina ,department of obstetrics and gynecology ,alexandria university,alexandria,egypt,20255

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: shatby maternity univeristy hospital beside bibliotheca alexandrina ,department of obstetrics and gynecology ,alexandria university,alexandria,egypt,20255

ethicsAndSummary.summary: this is a prospective interventional study where cervical excision in pieces will be performed in obese patients with long cervix and fibroid uterus with deep pelvis .this is mainly done for easy exposure ,
